content: nautilus 1954 is a washington-based & growing community of knitters and crocheters that have taken the mission to express gratitude and love to our united states navy submarine fleet through handknit & crocheted wool hats find us on facebook nautilus1954 & instagram @nautilus_1954 for more information skull cap 18 yarn requirements 50 75g 130 195 yards dk weight 100% superwash wool samples knit in plymouth yarn dk merino superwash needles us 5 16 circular needles or size to create desired fabric finished size adult skull cap one size fits most *optional modifications for a folded brim and/or a slouchy cap abbreviations k knit p purl k2tog knit 2 stitches together pattern cast on 100 stitches place marker and join for working in the round being careful to not twist the stitches brim *k2 p2* repeat until the end of round continue in pattern until brim measures 4 *optional for a folded brim continue knitting in pattern until brim measures 7 8 body knit in stockinette for 3 total length for brim & body = 7 from cast on edge *optional for a slouchy cap continue knitting in stockinette for an additional 1 total from cast on edge = 8 decreases round 1 *k18 k2tog* continue to end of round round 2 knit all stitches round 3 *k17 k2tog* continue to end of round round 4 knit all stitches round 5 *k16 k2tog* continue to end of round round 6 knit all stitches round 7 *k15 k2tog* continue to end of round round 8 *k14 k2tog* continue to end of round round 9 *k13 k2tog* continue to end of round round 10 *k12 k2tog* continue to end of round round 11 *k11 k2tog* continue to end of round round 12 *k10 k2tog* continue to end of round round 13 *k9 k2tog* continue to end of round round 14 *k8 k2tog* continue to end of round round 15 *k7 k2tog* continue to end of round round 16 *k6 k2tog* continue to end of round round 17 *k5 k2tog* continue to end of round round 18 *k4 k2tog* continue to end of round finishing break yarn and secure by threading the long tail through all remaining 25 stitches and then through every 5th stitch pull tail snug to close the top of the cap block & weave in ends this free pattern is adapted from a pattern written and published by maud churchill nicoll in knitting and sewing how to make seventy useful articles for men in the army and navy 1918 while the original pattern is long out of print as a historical artifact several pdf versions of the book are available online for copy and distribution
